intro: Sida torreyi, commonly known as Torrey's sida, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing annual herb with hairy, branched stems and small, pale green leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils in arid environments. Sida torreyi is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton.
